column4: Hi, I think I have a problem with a simple solution. I have intel graphics and was using the bleeder updates and the latest one killed X.. or something. Check out http://pastebin.com/d7cc54391 for the x failsafe log
that version was built under a xen kernel ... you arn't running xen are you?
not to my knowledge. virtualbox?
bad driver version, not going to work ... are you running virtualbox?
im running off low graphics mode atm. yes i run virtualbox
vbox within ubuntu ... or ubuntu within vbox?
vbox within ubuntu
windows xp guest
go into synaptic ... remove the bleeder, then run 'sudo dpkg-reconfigure xserver-xorg-video-intel
will do thanks
np
I ran the commandline, it thought for about one and a half one-one-thousands, no output. Is that right?
yep, now go into your /etc/X11 directory and look for  a backup file of xorg.conf that is older than your error and rename it to xorg.conf and restart X
thanks
terribly sorry but could you please tell me how to rename the file in the command line, i can't do it with gui as it is root
sudo mv /etc/X11/xorg.conf.whateveritis  /etc/X11/xorg.conf
looks good
any luck?
heya. looks like a kernel problem.
what kernel do you have ... uname -a
actually i also booted into an old kernel with grub come to think of it. let me try a normal boot
oops. ill bother you again after i try to reinstall the driver

all right, i'm at a loss. I believe the problem is it is not recognizing the driver or no driver is installed or something similar. on boot up i get error can't find intel EE 00 or something similar and then it goes into what seems to be some sort of lesser back up GUI where I can 'reconfigure graphics settings' 'troubleshoot' 'drop to commandline' etc

I should rprobably also mention that for months I have been getting error 26fs where I can continue by hitting space or pick a graphics mode. i hit space and it works fine. this was after some particular bleeder upgrade.
